wikipedia_page.main: Thomas Owen (1840-1898) was a British Liberal politician who represented Launceston, Cornwall in the House of Commons from 1892 to 1898.

List of MPs elected in the 1892 United Kingdom general election

response: *Thomas Owen (died 1598), English judge and politician, MP for Shrewsbury
*Thomas Owen (died 1661), English politician, MP for Shrewsbury
*Thomas Owen (Launceston MP) (1840–1898), British politician, MP for Launceston, Cornwall
*Thomas Owen (priest) (1749–1812), Welsh Anglican priest and translator of works on agriculture
*Thomas Owen (author) (1910–2002), Belgian author of weird and supernatural fiction
The 1898 Launceston by-election was held on 3 August 1898.  It was held due to the death of the incumbent Liberal MP Thomas Owen.  It was retained by the Liberal candidate Sir John Fletcher Moulton.
